revised_title: The Refractive Character and Physiological Peculiarities of the Horse's Eye
tldr: The author examines the refractive character and physiological peculiarities of the horse's eye, focusing on the horizontal pupil, corpora nigra, and the role of oblique muscles in maintaining the pupil's position. The study aims to improve understanding of vision disorders in horses and potentially aid in prescribing corrective lenses.
